moves.11... Bb6 12. a4 a5 13. d4 exd4 14. cxd4: ...I finally do get the usual KP opening central edge [White P at K4, Black P at Q3.]
moves.14... Nxd4 15. Qd3: I have a better central Pawn and more advanced pieces: Black's compensation is a material advantage of one Pawn.
moves.15... Bxf3 16. gxf3: Naturally, Black wants to exchange pieces to blunt my attack.
moves.16... Qh4 17. Nxb6: I remove the guard on Black's Knight. if 17... PxN 18 QxN will leave me up a piece for a pawn.
moves.17... Nxf3+ 18. Qxf3: Black's "desperado" knight captures a Pawn before dying. The correct move is now 18... PxN.
moves.18... O-O 19. Nd7: I take advantage of the opportunity to preserve the Knight.
moves.19... Rfe8 20. Qxf7+: Now I grab a loose Pawn.
moves.27... c6 28. Rc5: Since Black stopped my threat of RxP, I now counter by threatening RxKP.
moves.28... b3 29. Rxe5: The Black Rook is an "overburdened piece."
